alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 10 at 11:39AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following areas, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Jemez Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous slow moving thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and evening. Rainfall rates over one inch per hour are likely over the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon and Cerro Pelado burn scars. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
